form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Reid (for himself, Mr. Durbin, Mr. Schumer, Mr. Menendez, Mr. Schatz, Mr. Brown, Mr. Coons, Ms. Hirono, Mrs. Feinstein, Mr. Lautenberg, Mr. Blumenthal, Mrs. Boxer, Mr. Murphy, Ms. Cantwell, Mr. Levin, and Mr. Rockefeller) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To reduce violence and protect the citizens of the United States.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sandy Hook Elementary School Violence Reduction Act .
It is the sense of the Senate that Congress shouldâ€”

paragraph.text: promote common-sense proposals for preventing gun violence;
ensure children can attend school free from the threat of violence;
mitigate the effects of violence by promoting preparedness;
examine whether there is a connection between violent media and violent behavior;
enable the collection, study, and publication of relevant research; and
expand access to mental health services, with a focus on children and young adults.
